body.name: Small Dish Drying Rack, Compact Dish Rack Sink Drying Rack with Silicone Mat, Dish Drainer Dish Organizer for Kitchen Counter & Over Sink, Stainless Steel, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 16 hrs 3 mins
features: SLIM DESIGN: This combination design features a slim drying rack and a removable silicone mat, allowing for a considerable number of dishes only take up less counter space. Suitable for campers, RVs, boats, cottages, apartments, and small space organizations.

MULTI-PURPOSE: The mini dish drying rack easily fits on small kitchen counters or directly over the sink, providing ample space for drying plates, glassware, cutlery, and more. Includes a removable silverware utensil caddy that keeps forks, spoons, and knives separated. It's an ideal kitchen necessity for a family of 1-2 people.

PREMIUM QUALITY: The dish drying rack is constructed from sturdy stainless steel wire with a durable finish. The removable utensil caddy is made of durable plastic, while the drying mat is crafted from flexible silicone.

SILICONE DRYING MAT: Features BPA-free, Eco-Friendly, the silicone organizer tray can be used on kitchen and bar counters, or as a liner for refrigerators or drawers, a heatproof mat,a coffee cup or bottles mat,a non-slip pet food mat, even use it as a assucculents and other plants organizer tray.
THOUGHTFULLY SIZED: Dish rack measures 6.8"D x 16.9"W x 5.1"H. Drying mat measures 6.7"D x 16.5"W x 0.6"H. EASY CARE: clean with mild soap and water; drying mat only is dishwasher safe.
body.description: XYZLVSI Small Dish Drying Rack with Silicone Tray Narrow Design: The Dish Rack is an ideal space-saving solution for compact kitchens. Efficiently utilizes less countertop space compared to regular dish drying racks, measuring only 6.7 inches in width.Silicone Tray: It includes a silicone drying mat that can be placed together or separately, allowing for flexible storage options without altering the rack's overall capacity. Specifications: Color: Black Material: Steel & Silicone Item Weight: 2.4Pounds Weight Capacity: 25 Pounds

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sets up quick, holds plenty, and takes up very little space
reviews.reviewText: I debated on whether I wanted a slim dish rack or a full size and I'm glad I went with this slim one. I use a dishwasher most of the time so I really only need a small rack for the few occasional dishes I clean by hand. This takes up hardly any space at all so it's perfect for my needs. It looks nice too. I like that it comes with a rubber mat, which you could even use separately from the rack to dry more dishes like cups, while the rack sits on the sink with plates and utensils.Even though the plates overhang from the sides, the water drips down to the middle of the plate and lands on the mat, so no problems with larger dishes.I like that the rack can sit on the sink with the utensil basket removed or even hanging from the side. This little rack is versatile.Everything feels very durable. The mat is quite thick and strong. And there's nothing to put together, so you just take it out of the box and it's ready to use.One thing that might have been nice would be if the mat was angled to pour water off the side and down into the sink, but I personally don't need it. Just something I thought worth mentioning.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have a pretty small kitchen and counter space is limited, so this was honestly perfect. It fits nicely beside my sink in the corner. It was already assembled when I got it, so I didn't have to do anything other than decide which end I wanted the caddy that came with is. The caddy is a bit small, but it works. It's narrow and holds quite a bit more than you'd expect. It's metal with a plastic undercaddy to catch any water.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice dish rack for my RV...
reviews.reviewText: ...or a small kitchen for a couple. For me at home everything goes in the dishwasher, but my RV is not dishwasher nice. This is a perfect rack for my small trailer. Dishes, saucers, bowls all fit fine. Since my mobile kitchen is stocked with plastic, the fact that the rack is hard metal isn't an issue. There's room for dishes for 2 or 3 people most of the time. The silverware holder is big enough. The only problem would be if your sink is not flush with the counter. Setting this rack on the counter with the silverware holder over the sink (which is one way it can be used) will tilt the catch tray, perhaps enough that it wouldn't hold enough water, creating a mess on your countertop.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Small enough to fit in a medium-large-ish drawer for when you're not using it. Sturdy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Durable, Sturdy//Quality Material//Priced Fairly//
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice dish drying rack. It is quite helpful in situations where a dish washer is unavailable. Moreover, it does have sufficient space for a significant amount of dishware and silverware. The current price point of $17.99 is extremely reasonable. I highly recommend purchase of this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for my small apartment!
reviews.reviewText: This dish drainer is great for my tiny kitchen. It takes up so little space beside my sink. It is well made with stainless steel covered by a heavy plastic. The silverware drainer is removable and easily usable on a table or counter top. It has a heavy plastic tray to collect the water drained. I would like it if there were a spout or opening in the tray so the water automatically drained into the sink and so you don't have to empty it.This is very useful and I like the way it looks, the black against my steel sink. It is very durable and will likely last for a long time. It is a good value and worth purchasing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The plates don't stand up straight
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I am temporarily living with my father. Recently, his dishwasher stopped working. In the meantime, we are hand washing dishes (a tedious task let me tell you!). I got this drying rack cause before we were putting dishes on towels to absorb the moisture. This drying rack is not bad but also not the best. I find that most plates don't stand up straight (like shown in the stock photo). If you put bowls/cups on this then it takes up the space where you would have put plates on it. So basically you can either put plates on there or bowls/cups, not really both at the same time. You can slide the silicone tray out from underneath this and put the drying rack across your sink if you chose to. It does have plenty of space for silverware though. I feel the size of this would work well for a small countertop.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Apartment Kitchen Hero
reviews.reviewText: This is a good space-saving design for a single's or couple's apartment kitchen. Its slim design takes up so little counterspace and fits over a standard sink, as well. It's perfect for my son's first place as it does its job with a tiny footprint and is a breeze to store when not in use.
